**About Rippling**
Rippling gives businesses one place to run HR, IT, and Finance. It brings together all of the workforce systems that are normally scattered across a company, like payroll, expenses, benefits, and computers. For the first time ever, you can manage and automate every part of the employee lifecycle in a single system.  

Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can hire a new employee anywhere in the world and set up their payroll, corporate card, computer, benefits, and even third-party apps like Slack and Microsoft 365—all within 90 seconds.  

Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.2B from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Greenoaks, and Bedrock—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes.  

We prioritize candidate safety. Please be aware that all official communication will only be sent from @Rippling.com addresses. **About the Role**  

As a Sr. Sales Enablement Program Manager you will be focused on ensuring the success of our revenue organization. You will partner closely with stakeholders across the business to help bring enablement programs to life and across the finish line. In this role, you will be responsible for the end-to-end lifecycle of your programs including analysis, project management, content development, training / execution, reinforcement, and measurement. If you have a passion for enabling winning teams, working in fast paced environments, and love to collaborate – this is the job for you.  

This role will sit on the Product Enablement Team within the Sales Enablement function. On a typical day, you will collaborate with stakeholders across the business to identify gaps and align on a path forward, document processes, and create a plan for an upcoming training or project you will lead. We’re looking for a self-motivated and detail-oriented person, who is passionate about driving the success of others and getting things done.  

What you will do* Become well versed in our products by self educating yourself through our resources and training to then help educate our sales organization on important product launches ; you’ll be creating and delivering training content through a variety of modalities depending on the importance of the launch.
* Develop and manage end-to-end enablement programs including product training, certification and reinforcement strategy, playbook design and development, content development, evaluation / measurement of program success.
* Partner closely with senior sales leaders in the Product Sales Organization to assist in additional areas of support needed such as all hands, team meetings, offsites, project management etc.
* Partner with key stakeholders such as PMM and RevOps to understand business priorities and ensure your enablement plans are aligned
* Review data sets (such as in Tableau) to help inform your enablement recommendations based on business gaps
* Ensure new sellers are onboarded successfully by building onboarding content, ensuring it stays up to date, and adding new/relevant content where needed.
* Partner with sales leaders to help build and facilitate skills training such as MEDDPICC, negotiation, getting to power, etc.
* Partner closely with the entire Sales Enablement function to ensure cross collaboration and communication are top of mind.

  

What you will need  

* At least 5 years of relevant experience in Sales Enablement, Program Management, Product Marketing, Sales, or Consulting.
* Ability to work in very fast paced environments, keep up with changing priorities, and not get overwhelmed with multiple tasks at hand.
* A strong interest in learning the ins and outs of the Rippling products!
* Highly organized, with strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize work efficiently
* Strategic mindset and ability work proactively and autonomously vs needing a lot of direction
* An aptitude for problem-solving and working cross-functionally with others
* Knowledge of MEDDPICC training and reinforcement (bonus points)
* Strong operational excellence skills – understands how to organize chaos, streamline processes, create workflows to support more efficient working processes.

This analyst lives within the Product Operations team which in addition owns Product and Development capabilities and tools while partnering closely with our Agile CoE (Scrum Master, Agile Coach) and User Experience CoE. The role of this analyst is focused on ownership of our FinOps practice partnering with our Cloud Platform and Finance team. This role is responsible to set up processes and tools that will ensure visibility and optional actions based on accurate and timely data to the business. Overall, this role requires deep understanding of cloud billing, heavy analysis and navigating the organization from individuals to leaders as well as from technical teams to our business. Detecting trends and being comfortable in communicating are a continual part of this position. Success in these efforts should result in maturing responsibilities of cloud usage, education and advocacy from teams of cloud spend, and the work must be done continually from a positive, business-enhancing stance with finance partnership.  

Key responsibilities:
Cost Management* Monitor and analyze cloud-related expenses, identifying cost optimization and offset efforts with vendor agreements and/or programs
* Support the cloud monthly budget process in managing consumption, show back, and savings in collaboration with finance and technical owners
* Ensure alignment of cloud spending with budget constraints
* Forecast cloud costs based on current usage, upcoming requirements and new projects

  

Resource Optimization* Analyze cloud usage patterns and make recommendations towards utilization improvements to both engineers of the product as well as their technical and business leaders
* Ability to communicate escalating anomalies and unplanned consumption spikes to leadership and the impacts to current and future spend
* Identify and implement strategies to adapt resources to demand, optimizing cost and performance
* Identify underutilized or unused resources and clearly articulate recommendations of appropriate actions

  

Data Analysis* Ability to analyze and report data in Apptio and "Cloudability" for transparency to product and project teams
* Provide regular insights and recommendations during portfolio reviews of cloud spend health
* Maintain financial reporting of cloud spend and utilization

  

Collaboration & Continuous Improvement* Work closely with cross-functional product teams and projects, including IT, DevOps, procurement, security to align cloud usage with business objectives
* Educate, raise awareness, and skill up the organization about cost optimization best practices across the organization
* Stay updated on cloud services, pricing models, and industry trends

  

Practice Management* Ability to articulate where we are in maturity of FinOps practices in a foundational assessment
* Define best practices around responsibilities and roles from a cost governance perspective

  

Qualifications:* Bachelor's degree in finance, business, computer science, or a related field
* At least 2 years experience in cloud DevOps, IT cloud Operations, Finance, or cloud cost management.
* Use of cloud platforms like AWS or Azure
* Strong data analytics skills that go far beyond just creating spreadsheets, actually analyze data
* Proven excellent communication and collaboration abilities, including leadership presentations and facilitation
* Familiarity with applicable regulations as they influence cloud usage
* Certification in FinOps or relevant cloud certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, etc.) is a plus. This can be agreed to be completed within the first 6 months in the role.

**Role Purpose**



We have 3 Senior Product Manager roles for our RCC [Reservations and Customer Care] organization. These roles will stand-up new and elevated product capabilities for: Reservations & Sales Experience space, Loyalty & Customer Care Experience space or Agent Experience space.


Responsible for leading the strategy to deliver quality products and experiences across the customer care & contact center experience or Reservations & Sales Experience or Agent Experience. This role coordinates among business stakeholders, developers, technical engineers, data analysts, and other functional SMEs to create a comprehensive and holistic roadmap that address both short and long-term needs. They guide in-depth business reviews, communicate and present across all levels of the organization and support cross-functional product teams. The Senior Product Manager will prioritize and activate their roadmap, managing the end-to-end product lifecycle from ideation to launch to adoption to optimization in an agile way, pivoting as needed in response to stakeholder and customer needs. The Senior Product Manager is skilled and experienced in generating innovative ideas for growth within their respective areas and must exhibit the ability to lead Product Managers that are responsible for higher-profile, more impactful products.


**Key Accountabilities**


* Lead development and implementation of product strategy: future state based on deep understanding of how the business works, incorporating customer insights, markets, competition, and distribution capabilities as well as the potential “game changing” new functionality and capabilities IHG will require to compete. This should manifest itself in a roadmap of initiatives including small enhancement and content refreshments to existing products as well as new product needs.
* Identify product opportunities far in advance of obsolescence, drive strategic planning, and artculate topline business requirements
* Applies domain expertise to provide thought leadership and translate vision into action to drive business growth.
* Drives product development by reviewing performance and directing work efforts of product teams to ensure products are aligned with company, stakeholder and end-user priorities
* Source data and craft test plans to ensure data-driven decisioning; use insights to inform priority of work
* Proactively seek input from stakeholders to align the roadmap against business and customer needs
* Forecast ROI, regularly report on product performance post launch, drive product adoption, and lead the vision for the optimization plan
* Measure product performance and lead performance improvement initiatives. Identify and understand the performance drivers and set up ongoing diagnostics and monitoring capabilities once implemented.
* Provides guidance on design of products while balancing dependencies and integration with other products across the enterprise
* Manage product lifecycles: continually evaluate product performance and key customer insights and ensure new product needs are identified far enough in advance to address needs before product obsolescence.
* Communicate product information: including product roadmap, specifications, value proposition, sales tools training tools and competitive information to stakeholders. Provide status updates to PMO for regular reporting cycles.
* Makes suggestions to drive operational excellence, create internal customer satisfaction and meet operational metrics
* Provide regular updates to leaders and partners, sometimes catering the message depending on audience
* Provides leadership, mentoring and coaching to Product Managers
* Attracts, retains and develops top talent to build a world class Product Management Team
* Conducts annual and mid-year reviews, reviewing individual development plans and providing performance feedback


**What We Need From You:**

**Key Skills & Experiences**


**Required Qualifications**



Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in any Business, Engineering Hospitality or related fields or an equivalent combination of education and work-related experience


**Experience**



6-8 years of progressive work-related experience as a product manager in a modern software development company


**Skills & Technical Experience**


* Critical thinking/analytical skills used in the development of product strategies and roadmaps
* Experience in bringing products/programs to life from ideation to implementation
* Ability to influence key stakeholders and tell a product story using data as well as anticipating and balancing their needs
* Ability to package and present delivery items in a clear and succinct way
* Demonstrated proactive problem-solving ability and demonstrated creative thinking skills plus strong tactics and strategies to adjust to fast moving, rapidly evolving marketplace required
* Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills for the purpose of providing information to clients, vendors, senior management and staff. Demonstrated ability to present new concepts, research findings, and business outcomes to various groups including corporate clients, senior management, potential vendors, and industry consultants.
* Demonstrated product management experience with modern, established product management processes in organizing, planning and executing projects from conception through implementation. Demonstrated attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks/clients required.
* Experience in formal requirements methodologies such as vision, scope, context, use cases, etc.
* Drives Engagement: Creating a climate where people are motivated to do their best to help the organization achieve its objectives
* Develops Talent: Developing people to meet both their career goals and the organization's goals, especially with hybrid or remote teams
* Has high EQ, which translates to self-awareness, ability to manage themselves, socially aware or attuned and are able to manage relationships
* Can self-regulate along the lines of mental, physical and emotional well-being while being remotely managed
* Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

**Preferred**


* Demonstrated hotel industry and contact center knowledge reflecting the entire customer experience journey (reservations – stay – loyalty – on-property, and ongoing relationship management).
* Interpersonal Savvy: Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people
* Manages Complexity: Making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems
* Organizational Savvy: Maneuvering comfortably through complex policy, process, and people-related organizational dynamics

**ASPIRE Program Overview:**  

The ASPIRE Program is an 18-24-month rotational program with 18 months of professional development (1 module/quarter). Participants will go through rotations within their specified business unit to gain insight and skills needed to be successful in their field. The program combines real-world special projects, ongoing learning and development, and exposure to multiple areas of the business, including leadership, to create a well-rounded future leader.

  


**What We Need:**


Mohawk is looking for our 'leaders of tomorrow' to join our leadership development program! If you are a critical, big picture thinker with excellent communication skills and a willingness to jump in and do what it takes to be successful while helping to grow our brand and the people you work with, then we want you!


This specific ASPIRE role is a Product Management Associate. You will be an integral part to our Wood & Laminate Product Management team and will rotate through different functional areas in this field.

* Recently graduated (within last 2 years) with a bachelor’s or master's degree in applicable field
* Excellent academic record with strong GPA (minimum 2.7)
* 0-2 years of relevant work experience (Internship(s) preferred)
* Strong Excel and analytical skills
* Permanent work authorization in the United States

* Working collaboratively as part of a fast-paced team, with strong personal organization, poise, and professionalism
* Communicating effectively with a wide range of individuals in written, oral, and interpersonal form
* Achieving results through team efforts, challenging established practices, and drawing relevant conclusions

* Exercising independent judgment and demonstrating solid time management and organizational skills, including the ability to meet tight deadlines and schedules

* At Mohawk you’ll have the opportunity to join our community initiatives and connect with our partners such as Susan G, Komen, United Way, and the Boys and Girls Club, to name a few
* We’re located in a pretty great spot – check out this video to see what we mean.

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Mohawk’s vertically integrated manufacturing and distribution processes provide competitive advantages in the production of carpet, rugs, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone and vinyl flooring. Our industry-leading innovation has yielded products and technologies that differentiate our brands in the marketplace and satisfy all remodeling and new construction requirements. Our brands are among the most recognized in the industry and include American Olean, Daltile, Durkan, IVC, Karastan, Marazzi, Mohawk, Mohawk Home, Pergo, and Quick-Step. During the past decade, Mohawk has transformed its business from an American carpet manufacturer into the world’s largest flooring company with operations in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Europe, India, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Russia and the United States.

  


*Mohawk Industries, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability/veteran committed to an inclusive workplace and a proud Drugs Don’t Work participant.*

**Product Manager, Imaging**

**Onsite, San Jose, CA**


Do you want to help advance scientific discovery, improving quality of life around the world? We do, too.


Molecular Devices has the opportunity to be the innovation partner that empowers scientists to fast-track research breakthroughs, leading to earlier diagnoses and safer drug treatments. We’re a leading life science solutions provider of high-performance bioanalytical measurement systems, software, and consumables. With Molecular Devices, you’ll grow your career with best-in-class teams in a culture of collaboration.


Molecular Devices is one of 10 Life Sciences companies of Danaher. Together, we accelerate the discovery, development and delivery of solutions that safeguard and improve human health.


Do you want to work in product management team? Do you enjoy developing and executing on product strategy that drives significant impact on the organization?


We are currently seeking an Imaging Product Manager located at our San Jose, CA site, reporting to the Director of Product Management.

**What we’ll get you doing:**


The Product Manager, Imaging will be responsible for overseeing the development, marketing, and lifecycle management of imaging products and solutions geared towards high content screening applications. Candidate will be responsible for defining and executing on the imaging road map to grow and expand our global high content screening business. This role requires a deep understanding of both the technical and commercial aspects of HCS technologies, as well as the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams to drive product innovation and market success.

**The essential requirements of the role include:**

* **Strategic Product Development:** Conduct thorough market research to identify trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape, and use this information to inform product strategy. Lead the development and enhancement of imaging products for HCS, ensuring they meet market needs and customer requirements. Develop and execute product roadmaps, aligning them with the company's overall strategy and goals.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Work closely with R&D, engineering, sales, marketing, and customer support teams to ensure the successful launch of new products.
* **Performance Monitoring:** Monitor product performance in the market, making data-driven decisions to optimize and enhance product offerings and expanding product margins.
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences, Engineering, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
* **Experience and Technical expertise:** Strong understanding of imaging technologies, high content screening, and related applications. Minimum 3 years of experience in product management or in a customer facing imaging role

**Travel, Motor Vehicle Record & Physical/Environment Requirements:**

* Ability to travel – up to 25% globally

**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**

* Proven subject matter expertise in high content screening instruments and AI based image analysis, including successful product launches in this market


The salary range for this role is $140,000-$160,000*.* This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.


This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.


We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.


Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.


At Danaher we bring together science, technology and operational capabilities to accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life. Our global teams are pioneering what’s next across Life Sciences, Diagnostics, Biotechnology and beyond. For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

title_x: Sr. Product Manager / Associate Director of Product Management, Oncology
description:
**Position Overview:**  

Natera is looking for an experienced and strategic Sr. Product Manager / Associate Director of Product Management to lead the development and commercialization of our Altera™ tumor genomic profiling product line. In this highly visible and dynamic role, you will drive the entire product lifecycle, from prioritizing new features and programs to developing a strategic roadmap and enhancing product performance. Your work will directly impact patient care by providing innovative oncology solutions to healthcare providers and stakeholders.



This role requires a blend of strategic thinking and hands-on execution, ensuring that our products deliver maximum value in the competitive oncology space.


**Key Responsibilities:**



* **Product Strategy & Roadmap Development**


* Develop and execute the product roadmap for the Altera tumor genomic profiling product line.
* Prioritize new features and initiatives, balancing customer needs and operational constraints.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Molecular Biology R&D, Software Engineering, Sales & Marketing, Clinical/Medical, Operations, Regulatory, and Business Development, to ensure successful product execution.

* **Product Performance & Improvement**


* Oversee product performance, identify key metrics, and collaborate with teams to drive continuous improvement strategies.
* Analyze performance data, develop actionable insights, and implement changes to improve product quality, efficiency, and market competitiveness.

* **Market Research & Customer Insights**


* Conduct Voice of Customer (VOC) interviews, market research, and competitive analysis to inform product development and support growth.
* Leverage market insights to validate new features, enhance customer satisfaction, and ensure product-market fit.

* **Business Case Development**


* Identify new business opportunities and create financial models to support product initiatives and strategic investments.
* Develop comprehensive business cases that align with company objectives and present data-driven strategies to senior leadership for alignment and buy-in.

* **Cross-Functional Collaboration & Communication**


* Collaborate with Marketing to define product positioning, develop market launch strategies, and create compelling marketing collateral.
* Communicate the product vision, progress, and roadmap updates regularly to internal and external stakeholders.
* Ensure seamless collaboration between departments to achieve business objectives.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Life Sciences, Statistics, Engineering, or related fields (Master's or PhD preferred).
* 7+ years of relevant experience, including 5+ years in product management, product marketing, commercialization, or strategic consulting.
* Experience with oncology products, diagnostics, or medical devices, particularly in molecular testing or somatic biomarker testing, is strongly preferred.
* Proven track record of leading product management initiatives in the life sciences or biotech industry.


**Skills & Abilities:**


* Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and influence cross-functional teams to achieve strategic goals.
* In-depth understanding of core technologies and the ability to translate customer needs into compelling value propositions.
* Exceptional project and process management abilities, with attention to detail and the capacity to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Basic financial modeling skills and the ability to develop business cases are a plus.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present to senior leadership and drive cross-functional collaboration.
* Strong analytical skills for data-informed decision-making and identifying market opportunities.

 **OUR OPPORTUNITY**



Natera™ is a global leader in cell-free DNA (cfDNA) testing, dedicated to oncology, women's health, and organ health. Our aim is to make personalized genetic testing and diagnostics part of the standard of care to protect health and enable earlier and more targeted interventions that lead to longer, healthier lives.



The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. When you join Natera, you'll work hard and grow quickly. Working alongside the elite of the industry, you'll be stretched and challenged, and take pride in being part of a company that is changing the landscape of genetic disease management.


**WHAT WE OFFER**



Competitive Benefits - Employee benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life and disability plans for eligible employees and their dependents. Additionally, Natera employees and their immediate families receive free testing in addition to fertility care benefits. Other benefits include pregnancy and baby bonding leave, 401k benefits, commuter benefits and much more. We also offer a generous employee referral program!



For more information, visit www.natera.com.



Natera is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace environment, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Inclusive collaboration benefits our employees, our community and our patients, and is critical to our mission of changing the management of disease worldwide.



All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, and will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.


*If you are based in California, we encourage you to read this important information for California residents.*



Link: https://www.natera.com/notice-of-data-collection-california-residents/



Please be advised that Natera will reach out to candidates with a @natera.com email domain ONLY. Email communications from all other domain names are not from Natera or its employees and are fraudulent. Natera does not request interviews via text messages and does not ask for personal information until a candidate has engaged with the company and has spoken to a recruiter and the hiring team. Natera takes cyber crimes seriously, and will collaborate with law enforcement authorities to prosecute any related cyber crimes.



For more information:  

* BBB announcement on job scams
* FBI Cyber Crime resource page

As a **Sr.** **Product Manager I**, you'll play a critical part in shaping and delivering cutting-edge solutions that meet the unique needs of our government partners with the goal of making an impact across the federal government. Your expertise in both product management and government processes will be essential as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and launch innovative IT and cloud products.



We know that you can't have great technology services without amazing people. At MetroStar, we are **obsessed** withour people and have led a two-decade legacy of building the best and brightest teams. Because we know our future relies on our deep understanding and relentless focus on our people, we live by our mission: A passion for our people. Value for our customers.



If you think you can see yourself delivering our mission and pursuing our goals with us, then check out the job description below!


**What you'll do:**


* Build strong relationships with government stakeholders, understanding their requirements, challenges, and objectives.
* Serve as the primary point of contact, ensuring alignment between the product development roadmap and government priorities.
* Develop a comprehensive product strategy tailored to the government sector and conduct market research, competitive analysis, and customer feedback gathering to identify opportunities for new products and enhancements to existing offerings.
* Create and maintain a clear and prioritized product roadmap that aligns with the government client's objectives and timelines.
* Collaborate with engineering, design, and other teams to define features, functionalities, and project milestones.
* Translate government client needs into detailed product requirements, user stories, and use cases.
* Clearly communicate these requirements to development teams and ensure accurate implementation.
* Ensure the quality and performance of products meet government standards and compliance requirements.
* Coordinate testing and validation processes to guarantee reliability, security, and functionality.
* Prepare reports and presentations that effectively communicate product plans, progress, and results.


**What you'll need to succeed:**


* A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or a related field. Advanced degrees or relevant certifications are a plus.
* 10+ years in product management, preferably with a focus on IT and cloud products.
* An in-depth understanding of government processes, compliance, and security requirements related to IT and cloud solutions.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions, and exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities to effectively collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Proficiency in agile methodologies and project management tools, along with experience with market research, competitive analysis, and product positioning.
* Familiarity with software development lifecycle and technical concepts related to IT and cloud services.
* A demonstrated track record of successfully launching and managing products from concept to market.
* The Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, adapting to changing priorities and requirements.
* An Active TS//SCI clearance with CI poly preferred or Active TS//SCI clearance with ability to pass a CI poly


Like we said, **we are** big fans of our people. That's why **we offer** a generous benefits package, professional growth, and valuable time to recharge. Learn more about our company culture code and benefits. Plus, check out our accolades.


**Don't meet every single requirement?**



Studies have shown that women, people of color and the LGBTQ+ community are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At MetroStar we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic culture, so, if you're excited about this role, but your previous experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to go ahead and apply. We pride ourselves on making great matches, and you may be the perfect match for this role or another one we have. Best of luck! – The MetroStar People & Culture Team


**What we want you to know:**



In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.



MetroStar Systems is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of MetroStar Systems.


**Not ready to apply now?**



Sign up to join our newsletter here.


"EEO IS THE LAW MetroStar Systems, LLC (MetroStar) invites any employee and/or applicant to review the Company's Affirmative Action Plan. This plan is available for inspection upon request by emailing msshr@metrostar.com."

Position Summary  


We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Product Marketing Manager with a strong focus on strategic marketing to join our dynamic team. As a Strategic Product Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for driving the success of our strategy and our products, with a hyper-focus on e-mobility and solar through strategic planning, positioning, and go-to-market strategies. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product management, sales, sustainability, corporate communications, and marketing, to develop and tactically execute effective marketing strategies that align with the company's overall goals and objectives.  


Responsibilities  


Strategic Planning: Analyzing data and identifying trends that can be used to create effective strategies. Develop and implement comprehensive product marketing strategies that align with the company's overall business objectives. Conduct market research and analysis to identify market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape. Leverage this information to drive strategic decision-making and influence product development plans.  
Positioning and Messaging : Develop compelling product positioning and messaging that differentiates our products in the market. Clearly articulate the value proposition, key features, and benefits of our products to target audiences. Collaborate with the creative team to create impactful marketing collateral and content that effectively communicates the value of our products.  
Go-to-Market Strategy : Develop and execute go-to-market plans for new product launches, feature releases, and market expansions. Define target segments and create tailored marketing strategies to reach and engage these audiences. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful product launches and seamless execution of marketing campaigns.  
Competitive Analysis : Conduct thorough competitive analysis to identify strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats. At tradeshows gather voice of customer intelligence by speaking with customers and listening in on customer meetings to help the sales and product teams monitor market trends and assess competitive landscape to inform strategic marketing decisions. Provide actionable insights to stakeholders on market positioning, and product enhancements based on competitive intelligence.  
Sales Enablement: Collaborate closely with the sales team to develop sales enablement tools, including sales collateral, presentations, and training materials. Ensure the sales team is equipped with the necessary knowledge and resources to effectively position and sell our products. Provide ongoing support and guidance to sales representatives regarding product features, benefits, and competitive positioning.  
Marketing Performance Analysis : Track and analyze key marketing metrics, such as product adoption, customer acquisition, and campaign effectiveness. Use data-driven insights to optimize marketing strategies, improve customer engagement, and drive revenue growth. Provide regular reports and presentations to senior management on marketing performance and ROI.  
Keeps knowledge current on automotive, industrial, and solar, and EV landscape to help the company and their business customers understand their options.  


Minimum Requirements  


Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field (MBA preferred).  
Proven experience in product marketing, strategic marketing, or related roles.  
Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills with the ability to translate market insights into actionable marketing strategies.  
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.  
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and effectively with cross-functional teams.  
Experience in developing and executing go-to-market plans for new products or features.  
Experience with EV technology, energy, or automotive products and services.  
Knowledge of marketing automation such as Oracle Eloqua and CRM tools is a plus.  
Automotive aftermarket, industrial, renewable energy, and sustainable manufacturing experience desirable.

**About the role:**
-------------------



We are seeking a Staff Product Manager to lead the definition and development of our next-generation Infrastructure Graph platform service. This platform will be the cornerstone of our event-driven data mesh strategy, enabling seamless integration and management of complex enterprise infrastructure environments.


**What you'll do:**
-------------------


* **Product Strategy**: Define and drive the product vision and roadmap for the Infrastructure Graph platform service in alignment with company objectives.
* **Market Analysis**: Conduct thorough market research to identify trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape in infrastructure and event-driven systems.
* **Cross-functional Leadership**: Collaborate with engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams to deliver a high-quality product that meets market demands.
* **Stakeholder Engagement**: Work closely with enterprise clients to understand their infrastructure challenges and translate them into actionable product requirements.
* **Event-Driven Architecture**: Lead the integration of eventing subsystems into the platform, ensuring scalability and reliability.
* **Data Mesh Implementation**: Oversee the adoption of data mesh patterns within the Infrastructure Graph to enhance data accessibility and governance.
* **Performance Metrics**: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and inform ongoing development.

**What you'll need:**
---------------------


* **Experience**: 10+ years of product management experience in enterprise software solutions, with at least 3 years focused on infrastructure or platform services.
* **Technical Proficiency**: Strong understanding of infrastructure technologies, eventing subsystems (e.g., Kafka, RabbitMQ), and data mesh architectures.
* **Leadership Skills**: Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage complex projects from concept to launch.
* **Customer Focus**: Demonstrated experience in gathering customer insights and translating them into successful product features.
* **Communication Skills**: Excellent verbal and written communication abilities, with experience presenting to executive-level stakeholders.
* **Agile Methodologies**: Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development processes.

**What's nice to have:**
------------------------


* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and infrastructure-as-code tools.
* Knowledge of HashiCorp products and open-source communities.
* Certification in product management or project management.


#LI-Remote

Our Story
We make modern classics with character. We believe in true timelessness, the integrity of well-made clothes, and since our inception, great quality at a great price. That’s in our DNA.
But, we know it’s not only about the clothes—it’s about the *feeling* it gives the people who wear them*,* whether they’re confidently giving a presentation in a well-tailored suit; basking in long salty beach days in vibrant, colorful sun-soaked swimsuits, or joyfully re-discovering their favorite Rollneck sweater in their closet again and again, season after season.
And ultimately, it’s about helping our customers be the best, most authentic versions of themselves.
And *that’s* what we’re after, to inspire people’s lives and style.
Our dedication to Diversity, Equity, Belonging & Sustainability has been celebrated with industry recognition, reflecting our commitment to fostering an inclusive and sustainable workplace.
POSITION SUMMARY:
We are looking for an Associate to join our Product Operations team, supporting product development processes, systems, and calendars. As an Associate on our Product Operations team, you will serve as a key member of the team responsible for optimizing and enhancing our end-to-end product development, systems, and sourcing process. You will work collaboratively with cross- functional teams to streamline and enhance our product operations. This operational role will provide significant exposure to a wide range of the business and teams. This is a highly collaborative role that works closely with Merchandising, Design, Planning, Sourcing, Tech Design, Logistics, IT, Finance, Quality Assurance, Social Responsibility, Sustainability, and our Hong Kong team for J.Crew, J.Crew Factory, and Madewell. The role reports to the Director of Product Operations.
RESPONSIBILITIES:* Be a key member in supporting cross-functional projects aimed at improving product operations, such as product development calendar optimization, new systems implementation and enhancements, vendor standards and policy management, and vendor onboarding process management.
* Be a critical team member to support the Director of Product Operations with special projects.
* Assist with identifying opportunities for process improvement and implementing best practices.
* Assist with analysis and evaluation of existing processes, identification of bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement, and support development and implement of solutions to address them.
* Drive a culture of continuous improvement within the cross- functional teams, supporting training, and guidance to team members on process improvement methodologies and tools.
* Create and update internal and external facing process documentation and policies
* Assist with key meetings content creation.
* Facilitate meetings as needed.
* Stay current with industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices in product operations, and support implement of relevant improvements to our processes.


SKILLS REQUIRED:* Bachelor's degree preferred or comparable job experience 3+ years of experience in an analytical, operational, or project management role, preferably within a Sourcing organization
* Minimum of 2 years of experience working in the apparel industry
* Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills, with ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* Experience with CLO 3D, PLM, and other Sourcing and Product Development systems
* Strong strategic and analytical ability
* Strong presentation skills
* Problem-solver and solution-driven
* Demonstrate agility in switching from project to project with high ambiguity, and able to reprioritize deliverables as needed
* Excellent verbal and written ability; Adept at presenting information and storytelling
* Ability to assess relatively complex situations and analyze data to make judgments and recommend solutions
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint


We welcome you to apply, even if you don't check all the boxes. Our passion is scouting life-long learners who are driven by curiosity, and who feel connected to our brands and share our desire to make an impact. We’re always seeking bright new talent who leverage their unique experiences to discover, grow and evolve with our teams.
Benefits + Perks* Health & Well-being - Eligible associates and family members receive medical, dental, prescription and vision insurance, family planning (fertility, adoption & surrogacy support), fitness discounts, medical travel and more.
* Associate Discount - We love our products just as much as you do! That’s why we offer a great associate discount across all of our brands (J.Crew, J.Crew Factory, and Madewell).
* Flex Fridays - In addition to our hybrid work model, we also close our office at 1:00 PM every Friday year-round.
* Community Impact - We support the communities where we live and work through our philanthropic efforts and the J.Crew Cares Program.
* Winter Break - In addition to our PTO package, J.Crew Group offers a winter break at the end of December to eligible full-time associates at the Home Office to provide time to refresh and recharge.


Note: Availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to work location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.
Salary Range: $64,200.00 - $77,000.00
At J.Crew Group (JCG) we aim to pay competitively for our company’s size and industry. The base salary offered will take into account internal equity and may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region of work premises, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The base salary is just one component of J.Crew Group’s competitive total rewards strategy that also includes the opportunity for bonus, competitive benefits and perks.
One of our core focuses here at JCG is creating a community and culture that builds belonging. We are deeply committed to our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion efforts, and we warmly welcome job applicants of all backgrounds.  

JCG is proud to affirmatively provide equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or citizenship, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, legally protected physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected under applicable law.

**Primarily Roles & Responsibilities**

* Act as the product evangelist, constantly identifying opportunities via Voice-of-Customer and internal feedback from our sales team to improve the AV portfolio’s performance in support of our business strategy, including new products, product line extensions, product revisions, product retirements, pricing changes, product positioning changes, and marketing/sales programs.
* Track and analyze the product portfolio’s performance and profitability versus the targets, inform key stakeholders, and identify actions needed to meet the goals. Create quarterly sales and profitability forecasts for the portfolio.
* Research, analyze and monitor the market for customer application needs, market trends, competitive threats and growth opportunities. Develops and manages the execution of a product roadmap.
* Provide guidance as product owner for Agile development whether internally or with 3rd parties.
* Create a clear, compelling business case for new product ideas including sales and profitability forecast. Develops product positioning to maximize competitive differentiation and customer value.
* Develop integrated go to market and introduction plans and schedules. Support needs of marketing, sales, and support including participating in tradeshows, product demonstrations and competitive analysis.
* Collaborate with marketing and sales to create marketing messages, product collateral (such as datasheets, white papers, and videos), customer-facing product roadmaps, TCO/ROI tools, etc.
* Provide product education to various internal and external stakeholders including sales, sales engineering and tech support.
* Plan, communicate and manage the process to retire products from the portfolio including customer transition plans or offerings.
Stays current with technologies and trends, and anticipates demand by building relationships with vendors, industry analysts, and engineering.  
* 

**Skills, Knowledge, Abilities**

* Self-motivated and driven with a results-driven attitude, market-oriented approach, and a curious mind.
* Skilled in the core areas of product management including customer applications and needs analysis, competitive analysis, market analysis, value-based pricing, product strategy, product roadmaps, product definition, product positioning, value propositions, and marketing/sales tools.
* Possesses solid business acumen to plan, monitor and analyze the product portfolio’s business performance, pricing and profitability, and to proactively decide on actions to meet the targets.
* Ability to build strong internal and external relationships with multiple stakeholders and foster an environment of interaction, collaboration and commitment.
* Excellent written, verbal and listening communication with many diverse stakeholders.
* Skilled with setting priorities in a dynamic environment and staying focused on what matters most

§ Travel is required, up to 20%, primarily in North America with occasional international


**Education/Experience Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in electronics engineering, computer science or a technical field (or equivalent technical experience.)
* 5-8 years of product management experience or a combination of MBA degree and product management, marketing, product development or business development experience.
* Some experience leading, coordinating and/or managing cross-functional teams in planning, developing or implementing information technology products or systems.

**Supervisory Responsibility**

None  



Black Box is a leading technology solutions provider. Our mission is to accelerate our customers’ business by valuing relationships with our team members, clients and stakeholders. By continuously growing our knowledge, we remain relevant in the market and are in a superior position to help customers design, deploy and manage their IT infrastructure. Black Box does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status, and endorses those policies and practices which seek to recruit, hire, train and promote the most qualified persons into available jobs.
#LI-JM1

We are looking for a **Product Support Manager** ! Join Sinclair Digital, the innovation engine behind the largest and most diversified television broadcasting company in the country. We're at the forefront of transforming how local news and television are produced, distributed, and consumed across multiple platforms. **This position is based in Seattle, WA.**This is more than just a management roleâ€”it's a unique opportunity to shape the future of our Product Support team from the ground up. You will have the exciting challenge of building a team from scratch, selecting top talent, creating a culture of excellence, and setting the standards for how we support our products and users. Your leadership will be pivotal in defining the processes, strategies, and vision that will drive our team's success. If you're a builder at heart with a passion for creating high-performing teams and a drive to make an impact, this role offers the perfect platform.


**Responsibilities:**

* **Team Leadership:**
        + Manage, mentor, and develop a team of Product Support Specialists.
        + Set performance goals, conduct regular evaluations, and provide constructive feedback.
        + Foster a collaborative and positive work environment that encourages professional growth and high performance.
* **Technical Support Management:**
        + Oversee the delivery of technical support to internal users of our CMS software application via phone, email, and ticketing system.
        + Ensure timely and effective resolution of user-reported issues by diagnosing root causes and identifying solutions.
        Monitor and manage the team+ 's performance against Service Level Agreements for response and resolution times.
* **Knowledge Management**
        + Maintain and enhance the internal knowledge base by documenting solutions and frequently asked questions (FAQs).
        + Ensure the team stays updated on system changes, new features, and best practices through ongoing training and communication.
* **Process Improvement:**
        + Identify areas for process improvement within the support function and implement strategies to enhance efficiency and service quality.
        + Collaborate with development, QA and IT teams to resolve issues and implement solutions.
        + Lead projects aimed at improving the product support experience for users.
        + Create a robust new hire training program.
* **Escalation and Issue Management**
        + Act as the primary escalation point for complex technical issues, or mishandled issues that require higher-level support or intervention.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration**
        + Work closely with Engineering, Product Management, Key Users, and other stakeholders to provide feedback and insights from the support team.
        + Participate in daily standup meetings and contribute to triaging new items and ensuring team participation is to expectation.
        + Test and validate bug fixes.

**Qualifications:**

* At least 3 years of experience in a management role within a technical support environment, preferably with software-related products.
* Strong understanding of web technologies and content management systems.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to lead, inspire, and develop a high-performing team.
* Familiarity with ticketing systems and support tools.
* Experience with reporting and analysis to gauge team performance.
* Deep understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* At least 5 years of hands-on experience in a technical support role in addition to management experience.
* Experience supporting software used in the media or news industry.
* Experience with video technologies.
* Knowledge of web development languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript. .
* Understanding of database management systems.
Experience with tools including Jira, Confluence, Slack, Google Analytics.  
* 

**Attributes:**

* **Leadership**
        + Natural leader who inspires and motivates others.
        + Skilled at providing constructive feedback and guidance.
        + Committed to fostering a collaborative and supportive team environment.
* **Positive Attitude**
        + Patient and empathetic
        + Enthusiastic and helpful
        + Team player

About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
The Product team sits within the Product & Client Solutions group of the Corporate & Institutional Services business which aims to provide best in class front-to-back services to Asset Managers and Asset Owners across the world.
The Sr. Product Manager role has 4 areas of responsibilities. These include:* Product Management Capability Lead-Custody Product Manager for asset pricing, and account opening
* Product Liaison-Primary liaison between Custody Product and the following product groups – foreign exchange, and cash. The liaison responsibilities will include reviewing FX and cash from a custody lens to ensure custody implications are taken into account with their strategy and operating model.
* Capital Liaison-Lead liaison between Custody Product, and Product Management Capital in the capital planning and approval process, and the monthly spend versus budgeted reporting. Partner with Custody Product managers to educate them on timelines, requirements, etc.
* Program Management- Lead the Asset Classification program to determine what issues types should be on our system, and how they should be classified.


The primary responsibilities for these 4 areas of responsibility include:* Developing market insights for target client segment markets and evaluating industry trends.
* Formulating strategy for the group by aligning cross functional teams, uncovering opportunities and determining life cycle states.
* Shaping the value proposition, develop the business case and define the marketing mix model as part of the new product planning process.
* Leading and introducing new products to the market by securing regulatory approvals, publishing marketing material and conducting sales training.
* Assessing industry movement and refine value based pricing post the launch of new products.
* Attending and presenting at industry events and publishing in industry publications.
* Providing sales support including presenting at client and prospect meetings.
* Creating strategies for cross-program coordination and go-to market rollouts.
* Carrying out complex initiatives involving multiple disciplines and/or ambiguous issues.
* Displaying a balanced, cross-functional perspective, liaising with the business to improve efficiency, effectiveness and productivity.
* Conducting post launch audits, tracks product success, analyses P &L, metrics, KPIs, Makes recommendations for improvements to promotional programs.


The ideal candidate should have a fair amount of the following qualities:* Prior experience in a Custody bank
* Excellent communication skills; verbal, non-verbal and written
* Proven proficiency in constructing/overseeing logical and conclusive presentations, distilling complex subject matter into management-ready materials
* Strong understanding of client needs and how this impacts the product development agenda/roadmap
* Proven expertise in building key relationships, influencing and negotiating with clients, partners and leaders across multiple disciplines
* Prior programme or project management experience is advantageous; especially relating to planning, analysis, design and governance
* Knowledge of business strategy development is necessary to provide long term planning and to manage the profitability/performance of a major business segment.
* Leadership and organizational skills are required to determine the Business Unit's goals, resources needed, and to assess and develop the skills of staff.
* A College or University degree and/or relevant work experience in a business or strategic development related area

**Job Description:**

**About the Company:**


Join AT&T and reimagine the communications and technologies that connect the world. Our Consumer Technology experience team is delivering innovative and reliable technology solutions to power differentiated, simplified customer experiences. Bring your bold ideas and fearless risk-taking to redefine connectivity and transform how the world shares stories and experiences that matter. When you step into a career with AT&T, you won’t just imagine the future-you’ll create it.

**About the Team:**


AT&T is looking for a Senior Technical Product Manager to join the Consumer Technology Experience (CTX) business unit who is passionate about the eCommerce industry and has analytical and multi-tasking abilities to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

**About the Job:**


This is a technical job limited to technical organizations. The Senior Technical Product Manager is responsible for defining and driving the product vision, roadmap, and execution by collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver customer-centric software solutions and meet business objectives. Requires familiarity with software development methodologies and best practices, service-oriented architecture, and product analytics, and experience in managing Ing complex or high-priority technical products and influencing strategic decisions related to the product.

**Key Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Act as a subject matter expert and acknowledged authority within the organization for assigned product(s) or product line(s).
* Develop technical product vision and strategy by understanding customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape.
* Define and prioritize the technical product roadmap by collaborating with cross-functional teams, including business, architecture, UX, and other product managers.
* Guide product development by defining and communicating detailed software product requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Ensure technical product viability, desirability, and alignment with business goals by establishing success criteria and monitoring product performance.
* Work closely with Architecture and Engineering on technical design and to identify and manage critical dependencies.
* Support trade-off discussions, negotiations, and alignment on feature prioritization, technical solutions, and timing with stakeholders.
* Serve as the voice of the customer, ensuring a consistent, high-quality user experience throughout the product lifecycle.
* Participate in Epic/Feature planning and support feature refinement, addressing questions and providing guidance as needed.
* Write user stories and sets the product direction at the team level; OR write features and sets the direction for a group of teams; OR write epics and sets the direction for multiple groups of teams.
* Responsible for charting and executing the course for AT&T’s customer and employee digital experience across our consumer distribution channels.

* Well-rounded technical background in current web and micro-service technologies is required.
* Experience launching external customer facing Front end experience is required
* Past scrum team PM experience, working with UX, QA teams, Product releases, insights, VOC analysis is required.
* Use case development, story grooming, business case planning, defining MVP.
* Product release planning, technical refinement with architects is required.
* Knowledge of micro services, swagger, basic understanding of react applications is preferred
* CSPO, PMC or equivalent product certifications are preferred
* MBA with technical background is preferred.

Intermediate level technical professional. Subject matter technical knowledge within a discipline and sound understanding of ATT technologies.

Preferred technical Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Engineering. Experience working with highly technical software products.

Typically requires 3-5 years experience. Technical Career Pathway (TCP) role.

title_x: Associate Product Manager, Bone Growth Therapies
description:
Why Orthofix?  

We are a leading global spine and orthopedics company with a premier portfolio of biologics, innovative spinal hardware, bone growth therapies, specialized orthopedic solutions and a leading surgical navigation system. Our combined company is over 1,600 strong, with products distributed in 68 countries worldwide and a global R&D, commercial and manufacturing footprint, and this is just the beginning!
Come join our global team of dedicated professionals who through their extraordinary efforts demonstrate every day their commitment to our mission of improving the lives of patients. At SeaSpine and Orthofix our culture is built around Integrity and the core beliefs we live by: Exceed Expectations, Work Together, Be Respectful, Get Lean and Have Fun!
How you'll make a difference?
The Bone Growth Therapies Associate Product Manager is responsible for planning and executing marketing activities to drive revenue growth, adoption, and education of the BGT product lines. To learn more about Orthofix’ s Bone Growth Therapy solutions go to: www.bonegrowththerapy.com
What will your Duties and Responsibilities be?*Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.** Develop and execute strategic and tactical plans to support the market growth of the Bone Growth Therapies product line.
* Gather, understand and represent customer requirements as input to product improvements, line extensions, and new products.
* Monitor and analyze the market, our devices, and competitive devices
* Lead and actively contribute in growing our market share through product awareness campaigns, tradeshows and providing support to our sales team
* Provide support through the design controls process and launch activities for product development activities
* Collaborate with the Sales Advisory Council and Surgeon Advisory Board to develop value added programs, materials, and products.
* Develop and communicate product positioning and messaging to both internal and external customers.
* Partner cross-functionally to develop and revise collateral, promotional and educational materials as well as brand awareness campaigns.
* Develop and manage cross functional relationships (with Sales, R&D, Clinical, RA, QA, Ops, Sales Administration, Payer Development, Reimbursement, Training, MarCom, Med Ed, Compliance, Customer Care, and Legal departments).
* Support the various stages of the product life cycle including but not limited to: market research and analysis, design controls, launch and implementation, post-market surveillance, identification of user / clinical needs, forecasting, demand planning
* Identify and support new market opportunities.
* Gain a thorough understanding of the market, our product line, and competitive products.
* Support sales training, medical education, and trade show activities.
* Develop and manage external brand awareness initiatives for various customers (Sales Reps, Employees, Patients, Surgeons)
* Handle requests from the salesforce relating to general product information and literature.
* Assist in National Trade Show planning by representing the needs of the BGT product line.
* Create and manage a budget to support strategic and tactical initiatives.


What Skills and Experience will you need?* Undergraduate degree required.
* 2-3 years of experience in Medical Device, Sales, or Medical or Pharmaceutical Marketing.
* Excellent teamwork skills.
* Success in working as part of a cross-functional team.
* Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills.
* Strong understanding of social media presence, trends.
* Strong experience using Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, Excel, SharePoint, One Drive and Teams.
* Proven leadership ability as demonstrated in previous work experience.


What Skills are preferred but not necessary?* Prior experience in marketing Class III devices or DME products.
* Experience with launching products..


What will the Physical Demands and Work Conditions be like?*The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.** Regularly required to sit for extended periods of time; frequently required to stand, walk and use business equipment daily such as P.C., copier, fax, telephone, etc.; frequently required to reach overhead, bend, and lift objects of up to 40 lbs.
* Ability to handle stress caused by multiple priorities and other unforeseen situations associated with the organization.
* Eyesight and hearing must be correctable to standard level.
* U.S. travel up to 50%

At Curriculum Associates (CA), we believe a diverse team leads to diversity in thinking, making our products better for teachers and students. If you read this job description, feel energized by what you see here, and believe you could bring passion and commitment to the role, but you aren’t sure you meet every qualification, please apply! Above all, we are looking for the right person!
Why join this team:
This position is part of the expanding Operations group in engineering, that combines teamwork, innovation, work/life balance, and autonomy. You will contribute to the evolution of our AWS cloud infrastructure that supports Curriculum Associates’ *i-Ready* SaaS application as well as internal systems.
In a single program, *i-Ready* integrates powerful assessments and rich insights with effective and engaging instruction in reading and mathematics to address students’ individual needs. *i-Ready* empowers teachers every day to make more informed instructional decisions and motivates students with access to their own personalized path to growth. Want to be part of our impact? Join us!
Please note: Expected travel between 1–2 times/month to headquarters in Billerica, MA.
The impact you’ll have:* Collaborate, Support, and work closely with the operations team in planning and scheduling key strategic initiatives in the team’s backlog.
* Partner with key business stakeholders including all parts of the i-Ready platform, CISO, Corporate IT, Business operations to understand their businesses and co-develop impactful solutions that drive key business value.
* Use Agile processes to collaborate with partnering teams to execute on the roadmap.
* Work with team and organizational leadership to develop, communicate and promote the product vision and progress throughout Curriculum Associates including senior partners and Technology leaders.
* Collaborate with Platform / Operations teams to execute on short- and medium-term goals and to continuously review and improve processes.
* Work with senior leaders to develop and drive transformations towards self-service platform engineering solutions.


Who we’re looking for:* 4+ years’ experience rolling out CI/CD technologies and building infrastructure at scale with measurable impact and across multiple platforms or workstreams.
* Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience forming consensus out of ambiguity and complexity, coordinating with peers and team members and business and engineering partners, and helping teams move forward with sustainable urgency towards clear goals.
* Ability to create constructive relationships, influence, and communicate (to product team, engineering management, and non-technical staff).
* Highly developed organizational and reasoning skills with hypothesis-driven problem solving and the ability to turn data into actionable insights.
* A mentality that pushes through issues with creative solutions and tenacity, while maintaining grace-under-pressure demeanor.
* Bachelor’s degree in engineering or computer science or equivalent experience in a technical capacity.

Benefits and Pay Range:  

Pay Range – This role’s range is $93,250. - $166,250. The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that Curriculum Associates considers in making compensation decisions based on our Compensation Philosophy. Actual base pay within that range will vary based upon several factors including, but not limited to, prior experience and relevant skill sets. At Curriculum Associates, it is not typical for an individual to be hire*d at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances for each case.* This role is also eligible to participate in the company bonus plan. The Company recognizes that minimum wage varies by location and will ensure all compensation decisions comply with applicable state and local laws.
Benefits – Benefit eligible employees (and their families) are covered by medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees can enroll in our company’s 401k plan and receive an employer match. Employees have access to a flexible vacation and sick policy in addition to twelve paid holidays and a winter office closure between Christmas and New Year's, as well as a number of additional perks and benefits.
Application deadline: October 18, 2024. This is subject to close earlier if there is a high volume of applicants or a qualified hire is made.
