**Our History**


Border States is a leader in the electrical supply distribution industry with over 100 locations in 24 states. Our employee-owners are second to none in delivering top-notch customer service and in demonstrating extra-ordinary people skills. We are one of the largest independent electrical distributors in the United States providing products and services to the construction, industrial and utility industries. Border States has a competitive benefit package and is a 100 percent employee-owned company. Employee-ownership is a significant part of our culture and our success stems from the dedication of our employee-owners. We practice open-book management and our employee-owners are empowered with clearly defined levels of authority to be innovative and decisive, allowing us to respond quickly to the needs of customers. Employee-owners understand their roles in the success of the company and care about customers’ needs, which drives our focus on adding value to everything we do. We recognize that not all customers are the same and each has specific requirements. Our employee-owners understand these diverse needs and have the commitment, resourcefulness and flexibility to outperform all others.

**Values**  

As a Border States employee-owner, you’re responsible for living our mission, service philosophy and service standards.

**Mission**  

Border States provides value to our customers by delivering innovative product and supply chain solutions.

**Service Philosophy**  

We earn customer loyalty and confidence by caring about their needs and adding value to everything we do.

**Service Standards**  

Border States employee-owners are competent, accurate, responsive, and engaged .

**Your career**  

Join an experienced team at one of the largest electrical distributors in the United States. What are you waiting for?

 **Border States has a competitive benefits package which includes but is not limited to:**


Health, Dental and Vision Benefits  

Accident, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity  

FSA & HSA  

Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)  

Disability Benefits  

401(k) Retirement Plan  

Life Insurance  

Employee Assistance Program  

Paid Holidays  

Paid Volunteer Time  

Personal Leave time and more!  

Border States provides bonuses to their employee-owners upon the achievement of branch and company goals.

 **Equal Opportunity For All**


It’s not just the law. It’s something we’ve believed in since our founding. We value the diversity of all of our employee-owners and will always be an equal opportunity employer.

 **Drug Free/Smoke Free workplace**

**Category:** Innovations Technology  

**Status:** Exempt  

**Reports To:** Chief Product Technology Officer

  


**Job Description**

Koin is seeking a Customer Experience (CX) Product Owner for the Enterprise Applications Platform Team. This role provides vision, technical leadership, and overall responsibility for the Customer Experience product development efforts within IT and the Enterprise Applications team supporting our Genesys Cloud and Verint platforms.

  


**Compensation**


$105,000-$135,000 annually, depending on experience.

  


**Benefits**


* Medical
* Dental
* Basic Life Insurance (included with the dental plan)
* Vision
* Short-term Disability
* Combo plan covering accidents, hospitalizations, and critical illnesses
* Free on-site parking
* 401k (after 6 months of employment)
* Paid time off
* Paid holidays
* Bonus pay

  




**Location**  

  

In-person in Las Vegas, NV, 89103: Reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required).

  


**Responsibilities**


* Own the process of driving the organization to best practices. Demonstrate strong functional and influential skills in communicating to senior management stakeholders across the organization.
* Lead development activities in a cross-functional Agile environment, including teams spanning the enterprise and third-party vendors.
* Identify opportunities for operational improvements across Freedoms? various business partners and business application teams.
* Maintain the team?s product development backlog to ensure clear requirements are provided to the technical teams.
* Proactively identify and communicate regarding blockers, dependencies, risks, and status to all stakeholders.
* Demonstrate strong prioritization and skills which include multitasking, strong prioritization of tasks simultaneously, and the ability to make the appropriate judgment calls for trade-offs.
* Liaise with cross-functional teams such as IT, Project Managers, and various business partners upstream/downstream to influence accuracy and efficiency in CX deployments.
* Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Must have advanced presentation skills to ensure that complex ideas, thoughts, and visions can be communicated effectively.
* Thrive in a highly collaborative environment.

  




**Skills / Experience**


* Bachelor?s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
* At least 7 years of experience in designing, developing, building, and implementing software in a team environment.
* At least 5 years of hands-on experience as a technical lead developing CX integrations in a scalable environment.
* At least 3 years of experience working as a Product Owner or at least 5 years of experience as an IT Analyst working in a product-oriented organization.
* At least 3 years of experience working within the financial services and or gaming industry.
* Demonstrated success in balancing technical data constructs with user requirements.
* A demonstrated ability to analyze, design, develop and troubleshoot enterprise integrations internally and externally with third-party applications.
* Ability to design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
* Deep understanding and deployment experience with Genesys Cloud and Verint platform capabilities.
* Strong object-oriented programming experience with understanding of algorithms, data structures, and design patterns.
* Ability to identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
* Understanding of operating systems, and virtual machine architecture and concepts.
* Ability to translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
* Understanding of test coverage and code review tools.
* Experience with Agile development methodologies and a strong understanding of design principles.
* Experience with wireframing, prototyping using design tools such as Figma.
* Understanding of automated test methodologies and tools such as Junit, Selenium, Cypress.io, Webdriver, and/or TestComplete.
* Strong knowledge of UX fundamentals and best practices.
* Understanding of HTML5 and modern JavaScript libraries for developing front end systems such as Node.js, React, Vue, and/or Angular.
* Understanding of web-based APIs, such as RESTful and SOAP services.
* Familiarity with CI/CD mechanisms such as Gitlab, CI, Jenkins, and/or Bitbucket pipelines.
* Familiarity and experience with Twilio.
* Experience with Salesforce.
* Experience with Jira and/or other related issue & product tracking software.
* Demonstrated success in balancing technical data constructs with user requirements.
* Ability to influence, motivate and ensure execution.
* Strong written, oral, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills with the proven ability to negotiate expectations between multiple parties.
* Experience working in a high scale, team-oriented, and fast-paced environment.

  




**Bonus Skills / Experience**


* Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Certified SAFe Product Owner certifications are a plus.

  




KOIN is committed to building a diverse workforce. As an equal opportunity employer, we believe merit is everything and we consider qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title_x: Product Development Manager - San Diego, CA
description:
**POSITION IDENTIFICATION**


**Title:** **Product Development Manager**


**Location: San Diego**


**Target Start Date:****Immediately**

 **COMPANY DESCRIPTION**



Impact Housing (IH) is a mission-driven company headquartered in Southern California. Specializing in the design, development, construction, and activation of unsubsidized affordable housing for low- and moderate-income households, IH employs innovative off-site construction and modular design methods to swiftly address housing needs in San Diego and Los Angeles. To date, Impact Housing has deployed over 800 units from our product line into the market, each ranging in cost from $275,000 to $400,000.

  



IH operates as a vertically integrated company, possessing in-house manufacturing, architecture, and general contracting capabilities that create an ideal environment for cutting-edge product development efforts for the continuous improvement of its product line(s). Presently, the company can produce and erect approximately 1,000 residential units annually. With a growing presence in the market, IH intends to augment its production capacity to align with the evolving demands of the market.

  


**PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AT IMPACT HOUSING**



The cornerstone of Impact Housing's strategy lies in the development and continuous improvement of our product line of standardized residential units, designed for manufacturing and maintainability. Building upon eight years of refinement, our current product line, currently Version 2, embodies this ethos.

  




Impact Housing views product development as a comprehensive initiative that encompasses not only the physical units but the entirety of our current and future tenants’ interactions with our company. Much like a hospitality company that employees an overarching brand and market strategy, we intentionally develop and improve the building environment, including entries, indoor and outdoor amenities, as well as other customer touchpoints, such as marketing, the leasing process, and other key touchpoints, including a tenant digital app we will be developing.

  


**SUMMARY OF POSITION**



A multi-disciplinary team of Impact Housing personnel is presently engaged in analyzing potential enhancements to the product line, drawing insights from consumer, investor, and lender feedback, which underscores the need to identify a product development professional to assume leadership of this mission-critical initiative.


Impact Housing is seeking an exceptional and experienced Product Development Manager to join our growing team. The Product Development Manager is a pivotal professional who spearheads the creation and refinement of our standard residential units at Impact Housing. This position will blend insights from our tenant population, investors, lenders, and our highly experienced internal teams to guide the product development process. Charged with the task of aligning product offerings with business objectives, and adept in navigating complexities of product lifecycles, ensuring that each phase meets quality, cost, and time–to–market expectations. This role is both strategic and tactical, requiring a balance of creative vision and pragmatic decision-making to successfully bring products to life that resonate with consumers and bolster Impact Housing’s competitive edge.

  




**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Leading and coordinating cross-functional teams throughout the product development cycle.
* Articulating product vision and strategy alignment with Impact Housing’s business objectives and market trends.
* Conducting market research to identify customer needs and product opportunities.
* Continuously analyzing competitive offerings in Southern California and around the country to inform and inspire product innovation.
* Developing and managing product roadmaps, timelines, and budgets.
* Overseeing design, prototyping, and testing phases to ensure product specifications are met.
* Collaborating with internal teams to optimize product quality and manufacturability.
* Implementing agile methodologies and best practices to enhance product development processes.
* Working with branding, marketing, and leasing teams to develop go-to-market strategies and fine tune product positioning and brand messaging.
* Monitoring product performance post-launch and incorporating feedback into future development.
* Managing stakeholder communication, providing regular updates on product progress and milestones to corporate leadership, investors, and other key groups.
* Establishes the strategic direction of the company’s product development operations; executes this strategy in collaboration with company leadership.
* Oversees the product process from development through production; proactively addresses and solves any issues and risks that arise.
* Tracks, analyzes, and reports product, program, and process costs.
* Maintains knowledge in developing trends and technologies in the industry.

  


**REQUIRED SKILLS AND ABILITIES**

  

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to improve business processes and practices to reduce costs and increase efficiency.
* Ability to identify and implement best practices and continual performance measurement.
* Excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Strong supervisory and leadership skills.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and product development software.
* Proficient with the financial tools required to make estimates, business forecasts, and strategic decisions.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Ability to work in a fast-paced office environment, multi-task, and meet critical deadlines with an eye for accuracy and attention to detail.
* Ability to work with all levels of project staff and organization.
* Experience with Smartsheet, Project Sight, and QuickBooks preferred.
* This position summary is not a complete representation of the position; the essential function of the position may change as duties are assigned.

  


**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**

  


* At least ten years of experience in a product development role.
* Bachelor’s degree in a related field required; master’s degree preferred.

  


**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.

  



**COMPENSATION**


* Competitive salary range of $155,000 - $165,000 depending on experience.
* Health benefits, Medical Dental, FSA, HAS
* Competitive Bonus
* Vacation
* Sick time
* Holiday pay
* Ownership of company equity
* 401K Retirement Plan

  

Impact Housing is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, color, religion, national origin, medical condition, pregnancy, sex, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

With over 10+ years of experience in the laser engraving industry, OMTech is a trusted name in the laser engraving community. At OMTech, our passion for laser machines and the engraver community we serve is our source of pride.

  

The Product Customer Support Manager at OMTech Laser is responsible for overseeing the technical support team, ensuring high-quality customer support, and maintaining service excellence. This role involves managing daily operations, providing technical guidance, and supporting the development of team members. The Product Customer Support Manager will ensure timely and effective resolution of technical issues and contribute to the continuous improvement of support processes. This person will report directly to the Chief Operating Officer (COO) and must be flexible to accommodate meetings with our China team during after-hours at least 2-3 times a week.

 **Key Responsibilities**


* **Technical Support Leadership**: Lead and manage a team of technical support specialists responsible for providing assistance to customers experiencing issues with OMtech laser systems. Provide guidance, training, and mentorship to ensure the team delivers high-quality technical support services.
* **Customer Escalations**: Serve as the escalation point for complex technical issues that cannot be resolved by front-line technical support staff. Investigate escalated cases, analyze root causes, and work with internal teams to develop and implement solutions to address customer concerns effectively.
* **Problem Resolution**: Assist technical support staff in diagnosing and troubleshooting technical issues reported by customers. Provide expertise and guidance in resolving technical problems related to laser system operation, software functionality, hardware components, and system integration.
* **Customer Communication**: Maintain regular communication with customers to provide updates on the status of escalated cases, gather additional information as needed, and ensure timely resolution of technical issues. Foster positive relationships with customers by demonstrating empathy, professionalism, and a commitment to customer satisfaction.
* **Technical Documentation**: Develop and maintain technical documentation, including troubleshooting guides, knowledge base articles, and FAQs, to assist customers and technical support staff in resolving common technical issues efficiently. Ensure that documentation is accurate, up-to-date, and accessible to all relevant stakeholders.
* **Quality Assurance**: Monitor the quality and consistency of technical support services provided by the team. Conduct regular reviews of support interactions, provide feedback and coaching to team members, and identify opportunities for improvement in processes, procedures, and service delivery.
* **Training and Development**: Coordinate and facilitate training sessions, workshops, and skill-building exercises for technical support staff to enhance their technical knowledge, troubleshooting skills, and customer service capabilities. Promote a culture of continuous learning and professional development within the team.
* **Performance Management**: Set performance goals and objectives for technical support staff, monitor performance metrics and KPIs, and provide regular performance feedback and evaluations. Recognize and reward top performers and provide support and guidance to team members who may be struggling to meet expectations.

  


**Qualification and Skills:**


**Must Haves:**


* Bachelor's degree in engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
* 5+ years of experience in customer or technical support roles in a product-based company, with at least 2 years in a leadership position.
* **Mandarin Chinese language requirement is a must.**
* Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex product based technical issues in a timely and effective manner.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey product technical information clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Leadership and team management abilities, with experience in coaching, mentoring, and developing the team.
* Customer-focused mindset with a commitment to delivering exceptional technical support and ensuring customer satisfaction.
* Proficiency in technical documentation, including the creation and maintenance of troubleshooting guides, knowledge base articles, and FAQs.
* Familiarity with CRM systems, ticketing systems, and other tools used for technical support case management and tracking.


**Nice to Haves:**


* In-depth knowledge of laser systems, laser technology, and related components, including laser sources, optics, control systems, and software applications.

**Supervision**



Reports to: Director of Business Line

  


**Come grow with us!**



Working at ViewSonic is a unique opportunity to do rewarding, meaningful, high-visibility work for a global leader in visual technology. At ViewSonic, we are celebrating 36 years of excellence, carrying on the same entrepreneurial spirit and innovation we’ve had since 1987. Our brand and products are well-known throughout the industry. As a result, we are growing quickly and are looking for energetic, motivated team members to expand our nest.

  




**Your Role and Impact**



The Product Manager (PM) will be responsible for the overall success of assigned category. You will develop, manage, and strategize all activities, achieving goals of market positioning, revenue, market share and profitability.

  


**Day to Day Responsibilities**


**50% of time should be spent in planning:**


* Recommend new product opportunities through market analysis, industry/technology trends, and “Voice of Customer”.
* Develop business strategy for **AV product category**. This includes how the product is positioned in the market, within the category’s product portfolio, and how it contributes to the company’s strategic objectives.
* Manage AV products through their complete product life cycle by direct participation and leadership in all cross-functional activities. This includes managing the product from launch, through the maturity cycle, and end-of-life transitions.
* Recommend pricing and promotional strategies for all current and new AV products to ensure their competitiveness within the target market. Concurrently, monitor the products gross/net margins and ensure the product is meeting the company’s financial and or strategic expectations.
* Provide forecast for AV products’ market demand and financial results that include sales revenue, market share, gross/net product margin, and promotional cost.
* Create demand generation plans for existing products and / or new technology. The plan may include programs that help switch market demand from a competitor’s products to ours.
* Keeps abreast of industry trends, competitive moves, and development trends for the purpose of enhancing overall market knowledge in AV products.


**30% of time should be spent in customers, sales support and press relationship:**


* Accountable for being the “Product Champion” and key company spokesperson for the **AV product category**. Understands the product, channel characteristics, and competitive forces for the channels the products are targeted at. Develop and implement the strategies and tactics to ensure the product line success in its targeted market.
* Capable of presenting to the Field Sales team, internal/external customers, and press ViewSonic corporate strategy, as well as responsible products’ technical roadmap and regular updates.
* Responsible for feedback follow-throughs of product development, pricing, and programs. Make recommendations for these opportunities.
* Able to travel with the Field Sales team for customer visits, customer sales training, and customer event supports; with the PR group for press tours; and with Marketing and Sales team for trade show/roadshow support. Overseas travel may be required for global product planning meetings.


**20% of time should be spent in coordination, communications and training:**


* Drive and coordinate with MarCom and Channel Marketing Departments the development of market launch strategies, product positioning statements, functional specifications, ad copy, WEB information, sales training information, and ensure they are disseminated to the appropriate parties.
* Interface between Sales, Customer Service, and Product Development teams, to ensure product enhancement opportunities and quality feedback are proactively communicated for inclusion in the design cycle
* Participate in international conference calls for product development updates, supply updates, and problem area/action plan identifications.
* Conduct the Company’s new hire training, sales training, customer training, PR briefings through Webinars, sales meetings, customer visits or PR tours.

  


**Your Profile**


* BA/BS degree in Business or related field, MBA preferred.
* 3 – 5 years of experience in **AV product management** or product marketing responsibility required
* Familiarity with the setup, programming, and troubleshooting of Crestron and Extron control systems, as well as other AV control technologies. Able to integrate these systems to enhance user experience and streamline operations in conference rooms and other AV environments.
* Familiarity with configuring and managing Microsoft Teams Rooms, ensuring seamless video conferencing and collaboration.
* Experience managing and configuring Microsoft Intune for device and application management
* Must be self-motivated, energetic, creative, mathematically and analytically inclined with experience in strategic planning.
* Must have some experience in “classical” marketing and motivating distribution channels.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and participate in conference calls with Asia regularly or as the situation requires.
* Results-driven and have the ability to coordinate well with different functions.
* Strong presentation, writing and verbal communication skills.
* Proficient PC skills including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
* Ability to travel up to 25% of the time

  


**What’s in it for you:**


* Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance options
* 401k with company match
* Paid Time Off
* Company provided equipment

  


**Work Environment & Requirements**


* Environment: Hybrid, 3 days in office, 2 days remote
* Travel: Up to 25% travel, mostly to attend major tradeshows with occasional customer visits
* Physical Effort: Work requires infrequent physical demands
* Hazards: Negligible, little or no exposure to hazards

  



At ViewSonic, our mission is to provide excellence in visual experience by combining, products, solutions, and ecosystem developments. We celebrate and support diversity and are committed to creating a respectful and inclusive environment for all employee-partners. ViewSonic does not discriminate on any basis covered by appropriate law, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.

  




*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and requirements.*

**About Us**



Stanley, a HAVI company, is defined by Creativity, Building and Invention. We are makers of the legendary bottle and box. Driven by purpose, passion, and performance. Obsessed with making a difference and keeping our promises. Proud of our yesterday and focused on building the team of tomorrow.

 **Position Overview**



Stanley is seeking a Senior Global Compliance Manager to grow and mature the Compliance and Safety function for Stanley worldwide. This role will develop a long-term strategy and manage a global network, as part of the Quality department. Responsibilities include identifying and managing to global and regional product and packaging compliance/regulatory requirements, developing programs and working with cross-functional teams to ensure compliance. You will also own and manage Product Safety across Stanley’s New Product portfolios.

 **What You'll Do**


* Provide Product regulatory and safety expertise and leadership for Stanley. Identify and develop regulatory analysis and executive level recommendations for managing compliance requirements for new and existing business initiatives
* Responsible for the creation, updating and communication of global regulatory strategies for entire product portfolio.
* Build, implement and launch policies to operationalize global and regional regulatory and compliance requirements at scale
* Enhance and improve current compliance programs and develop programs for potential new product lines
* Promote aligned, innovative global regulatory solutions drawing upon global and regional regulatory expertise and strategies. Develop and maintain accurate metrics to measure Compliance and Safety program health and proactively identify risks
* Represent Stanley as the point of contact with regional regulatory agencies (such as FDA and CPSC in North America) and lead company delegation for regulatory authority meetings.
* Work with regional leaders to ensure consistent execution of compliance programs
* Monitor the development of new regulatory requirements or guidance documents and advise product teams of the impact on the business or development programs. Actively monitor US Federal, State and Regional activity related to product safety and chemical regulations
* Ensure exemplary behavior, ethics, and transparency within the company and with regulatory agencies. Ensure all regulatory development process commitments are clearly communicated, monitored and met.
* Research and develop product testing and performance requirements for new product categories. Work with 3rd party labs to draft and implement testing protocols and/ or vendor guidance documents when needed.
* Continuously evolve and update the product testing protocols to remain inline with industry and regulatory standards while upholding Stanley’s quality standards
* Mentor and develop product compliance professions within Stanley who are actively assisting in meeting product objectives
  


 **Who You Are**


* **Expert**. Proven track record of Product Compliance Management in the consumer products space with an exceptional understanding of regional regulatory obligations
* **Customer Focused**. Passionate about providing our customers with products that are safe and meet all regulatory requirements.
* **Analytical**. Ability to interpret and analyze complex numerical and financial data. Ability to make data-based and strategic business decisions driven by value, including making reasoned decisions in the face of uncertainty or imperfect data
* **Leader**. Proven ability to influence, with varying levels of seniority within an organization; experience mentoring team members; Ability to think big picture as well as dive into and understand the technical granular details of the product
* **Creative Problem-Solver.** A resilient, focused problem solver and self-starter with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a complex and ambiguous environment
* **Ambitious**. Proactive and able to define and implement projects independently; capable of designing creative solutions to strategic and tactical challenges
* **Communicator**. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively within all levels of the organization.
  


**Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree
* 10+ years of experience in a global product compliance leadership role preferred
* 8+ years running product compliance and safety, preferably in a leadership or role or technical advisory capacity
* Proficiency in IT systems and processes
  


**Salary Range**



$130,000-160,000 annually

About HAVI



HAVI is a global, privately owned company that connects people with ideas, data with insights, supply with demand, restaurants with deliveries and ultimately, people with the products they love. Whether we are sourcing, storing or delivering products, we bring unmatched category expertise and unrivaled operational excellence, combined with powerful digital analytics and insights. Founded in 1974, HAVI employs more than 10,000 people and serves customers in more than 100 countries. HAVI’s business units include Supply Chain, tms and Stanley. Our portfolio of businesses offers best-in-class sourcing and supply chain capabilities, brand defining marketing and promotion services and innovative consumer products. For more information, please visit HAVI.com, tmsw.com and stanley1913.com.

What You'll Do:

Join our Benefits and Protection Data & Analytics team as a Product Manager. Engage with business partners in our Distribution organization to understand their data needs, drive strategic plans, and make a significant impact.
Your day could look like:* Define and manage a clear product vision and strategy that aligns with Enterprise, Distribution, and Data & Analytics strategy.
* Lead discovery efforts in partnership with the Analytics and Engineering teams to understand business objectives and find opportunities to deliver flawless solutions.
* Prioritize features for data management and analytics solutions.
* Develop and articulate hypotheses, leading the product team - including design, engineering, and Distribution-focused business roles - in ideation and experimentation.
* Collaborate with Product Management and Engineering partners across portfolios to ensure aligned outcomes and to manage dependencies.
* Assess product health using metrics and partner engagement to continuously improve Data and Analytics products.
* Foster positive relationships with Analytics Consulting and Distribution business partners to represent their needs. Cultivate their support and actively involve them to ensure success.
* Champion a mentality and approach that prioritizes product development and problem-solving within the Data and Analytics industry. Identify areas for enhancing product management practices and take consistent action to drive improvement.

  


Who You Are:
* You have 4+ years of Product Management experience in a Data & Analytics organization; or equivalent demonstrated through work experience, training, or education.
* You have collaborated with collaborators to identify opportunities for delivering impactful analytics to their business. You have also partnered with Analytics and Engineering teams to implement effective solutions for those needs.
* Quickly find important statistics and metrics for business partners, using them to support crafting Data & Analytics product strategy and roadmap.
* You have demonstrated experience leading, influencing, and negotiating in a product environment.
* You are curious, open-minded, and motivated, comfortable operating in complex and highly ambiguous environments.


Skills that will help you stand out:* Understanding of Insurance Distribution channels and related analytics and data needs.
* Knowledge of SQL, AWS, Snowflake, and PowerBI.

Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.  

At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.  

As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.  

Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities. **The Role**  

The Associate Product Manager, Vault CRM Campaign Manager, is a critical position responsible for understanding the global Marketing Automation commercial landscape. You will be responsible for communicating the roadmap to internal and external customers, while working closely with the engineering team to bring your vision to life, as you jointly develop a world-class solution. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a team of life sciences industry and technology A-players, who, together, are bringing the next generation of commercial solutions to the life sciences industry.  

The ideal candidate blends traditional inbound product management skills, in-depth understanding of life sciences business processes, technology, and challenges, as well as a passion for solving complex design problems with elegant, inventive solutions.**What You'll Do*** Help define product priorities and roadmap by collecting and synthesizing input from customers, partners, executives, market owners, sales, services, and engineering
* Be the voice of the customer and work collaboratively with product development teams to design and deliver product capabilities that meet customer/market requirements
* Evangelize products and become the subject matter expert for internal audiences, external customers, and market-facing communications
* Collaborate with other departments (e.g. UX, engineering, QA, operations, etc.) to manage resources, timelines, and conflicts
* Ultimately you are responsible for creating features that are built, delivered with quality, and delight customers

**Requirements*** Experience using configurable SaaS solutions
* Experience writing detailed documents and prioritizing tasks
* Track record of effectively collaborating with others to deliver on a project or task
* Ability to understand and communicate architectural requirements, preferences, and limitations
* Experience interacting with customers, development, and consulting teams, both local and remote
* Ability to work independently in a dynamic environment, with little direct supervision
* Strong communication skills: written, verbal, and formal presentation
* A strong sense of professional ethics

**Nice to Have*** Experience with commercial aspects of the Life Sciences industry, including Inside Sales or Field Sales or Field Medical teams and their respective processes
* Prior work in software development, or computer science degree

**Perks & Benefits*** Medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance
* Flexible PTO and company paid holidays
* Retirement programs
* 1% charitable giving program

**Compensation*** **Base pay: $55,000 - $90,000**
* The salary range listed here has been provided to comply with local regulations and represents a potential base salary range for this role. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range above or below, depending on experience and location. We look at compensation for each individual and base our offer on your unique qualifications, experience, and expected contributions. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation in addition to base salary, such as variable bonus and/or stock bonus.


#LI-Remote  

Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.  

Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent\\_accommodations@veeva.com.
**Work Where It’s Best for You**
--------------------------------


Work Anywhere means you can work in an office or at home on any given day. It’s about getting the work done in the way and place that works best for each person. This applies across all locations and departments.



Work Anywhere does not mean work at any time. We have predictable core hours where employees are generally available for meetings and collaboration. Employees are focused and available during core hours.



We invest in our offices to make them places where our employees like to go. If you work in the office three or more days a week, you will have a dedicated office workspace. Our offices function as hubs to draw people in, create social bonds, and where random connections and mixing of ideas happen. We’re investing more in offices, culture, and offsite meetings, not less.



Product teams are organized in regional product hubs for optimal collaboration and live within a time zone of their hub. Our current product hubs are located in Pleasanton, Columbus, Boston, Kansas City, New York City, Raleigh, and Toronto. We create opportunities for teams to get together in person regularly.



Customer-facing roles, such as Sales and Professional Services, live near and/or travel to their customers.



When an employee moves within a country it does not cause a change in salary. Where you live impacts you and your family. Not knowing if your compensation will change if you move can cause stress and uncertainty for everyone. We wanted to eliminate that.



Work at Veeva. Work where it’s best for you.

**Early Detection Made Simple™**

Denver, CO based BioIntelliSense, Inc., founded in 2018, is an award-winning continuous health monitoring and clinical intelligence company. Our market acceleration and expansion are driven by world-class executive management and a dedicated team of engineers, data scientists, commercial and operational professionals, which collectively harness decades of expertise in virtual care innovations, wearable sensor development, remote connectivity solutions and successful program execution. With these distinctive capabilities and proprietary continuous Remote Patient Monitoring (cRPM) technologies, BioIntelliSense is uniquely poised to transform care delivery from in-hospital to home.

The FDA-cleared and award-winning BioButton® multiparameter wearables, BioHub™ gateways, BioMobile™ downloadable applications, BioCloud™ data services and the BioDashboard™ clinical intelligence system creates a comprehensive tech-enhanced solution that makes continuous monitoring reliable and scalable. Through the platform’s AI-driven analytics, clinicians have access to high-resolution vital sign trending and data-driven insights to enable earlier detection of patient deterioration and proactive intervention for better, safer care.

**Join the BioTeam today** and create a new standard of continuous care that delivers clinical value, economic benefits and operational efficiencies for providers, patients and caregivers globally! **About the Role**  

We are seeking a Senior Product Manager to lead the strategic planning and delivery of primary clinical interfaces with the BioIntelliSense clinical monitoring platform. BioIntelliSense’s FDA-cleared BioDashboard platform allows clinicians to simultaneouslymonitor thousands of patients whether in-facility or at-home, enabling clinicians to providing better care while unlocking significant economic value for health systems. The ideal candidate will have experience working directly with clinical users, translating workflows into impactful product solutions, and ensuring exceptional user experiences.
### **What You'll Be Doing**

* Act as the key bridge between clinical teams, customers, and product development, ensuring a deep understanding of user needs and clinical workflows.
* Collaborate with clinical stakeholders to map out workflows, prioritize features, and identify pain points that the product should address.
* Partner closely with design teams to deliver a high-quality user experience that reflects an understanding of the clinical environment and user behavior.
* Serve as the primary interface between the development team and the customer, gathering feedback, ensuring alignment, and communicating updates.
* Work closely with technical counterparts to ensure user stories, epics, and product backlogs are effectively defined to meet user needs.
* Lead user-story mapping, use case development, and product design discussions in collaboration with both internal teams and external users.
* Ensure product design aligns with clinical best practices, regulatory standards, and the overall product vision.
* Conduct user research and partner with Human Factors teams on usability studies to continuously refine the product and improve the user experience.
* Work with the marketing and sales teams to communicate the product's value proposition and assist in go-to-market strategies.

### **What You Need**

* BA/BS in Business, Healthcare Management, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
* 5+ years of experience working with healthcare technologies, preferably in a customer-facing role.
* Demonstrated ability to understand clinical workflows and translate them into high-quality product solutions.
* Experience working on cloud-hosted products for healthcare or other regulated environments.
* Strong grasp of healthcare regulations, data privacy, and security principles relevant to patient data.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage and collaborate with both technical and clinical stakeholders.
* Proven ability to deliver exceptional UX/UI experiences in complex, regulated environments.

**Salary Expectations:** Listed comp is total compensation and is based on experience and location**Work Location:** Remote - Must be based in the U.S.**Travel Requirement:** Must be willing/ able to travel if needed**You'll be excited about this opportunity because you will:*** Join a fast-growing company and grow right along with us
* Work on challenging and interesting tech problems which reshape the future of healthcare
* Get the chance to work on cutting-edge technologies
* Make a large impact across the company through business deliverables and continuous innovation
* Opportunity to build solutions and organizations

 **Why You'll Love Working at BioIntelliSense** **We are leaders** - Leadership is not limited to our management team. It's something everyone at BioIntelliSense embraces and embodies. **We are doers** - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead BioIntelliSense and healthcare industry is what we do. **We are learning** - We're not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even when it's inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job. **We have great benefits -** Medical/Dental/Vision/Life, disability (STD & LTD), 401(k) auto contribution program, 11 paid holidays per year, generous paid time off and a weekly lunch perk.  

BioIntelliSense is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran, disability status or any other status protected under federal, state or local law.

At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.



There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Most importantly, we seek people who are excited about crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.



Who you are:


* You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there.
* You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0.
* You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.
* You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.
* You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.
* You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone.
We are seeking a Product Manager to lead and enhance our HR Technology stack within the People Operations domain. This role requires a keen interest in various technology consulting practices, including user experience design, process modeling, requirements gathering, visual design, systems support, and agile methodology adoption from the outset. Our portfolio includes ambitious projects involving world-class implementations with leading cloud software solutions and custom software builds. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in Technology Consulting within fast-paced environments, demonstrating a strong history of making strategic buy vs. build decisions.



The Product Manager will report to the Head of HR Technology.



What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):


* Manage a portfolio of HR technology products, prioritizing the backlog and roadmap to deliver effective and efficient solutions.
* Foster strong relationships and collaborate with key stakeholders to design and implement the technology stack.
* Evaluate new enhancements and technology solutions, driving strategic buy vs. build decisions to optimize technology consulting practices.
* Intake new requests, assess their impact on the organization, and prioritize them accordingly to ensure alignment with business goals.
* Balance the needs for both functional and non-functional requirements in technology solutions.
* Model user experiences, business processes, system interactions, and data architecture to enhance technology effectiveness.
* Automate capabilities and processes, ensuring simplified and intuitive user experiences within Workday and other HR systems.
* Work closely with various HR Centers of Excellence (COEs) and Engineering teams to understand and document requirements for custom software development.
* Manage vendor relationships, including vendor onboarding, privacy reviews, security reviews, and audits.
* Provide system support and configuration updates within leading cloud technologies.
* Monitor system metrics and ensure adherence to system support Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
* Collaborate with the HR Analytics team to deliver actionable metrics and insights.
* Contribute to Quarterly Operational reviews, providing valuable input and insights.


What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):


* 5+ years of experience in HR technology, demonstrating successful influencing skills at the Director level.
* Proven experience with global HR platforms with a focus in Workday
* Excellent communication skills and ability to coordinate technical resources effectively.
* Hands-on experience with Agile methodologies, including breaking down epics into user stories.
* Collaborate with IT teams to drive integration initiatives, ensuring seamless data flow and interoperability between Workday and other HR systems.
* Develop and oversee user acceptance testing (UAT) processes to ensure high-quality implementations and system enhancements.
* Establish and track success metrics to measure the effectiveness and impact of HR technology solutions.
* Recent hands-on experience with administration, configuration, and systems support.
* Proven ability to create order out of chaos with minimal oversight.
* Strong vendor management skills.
* Working knowledge of Jira.
* Expert proficiency in Google Docs, Google Slides, Google Sheets, and Wikis.
* Nice to have: Working knowledge of AWS cloud configuration, MoveWorks, ServiceNow

Blue Yonder Title: Product Director - Retail
Location: Dallas, TX or REMOTE
Overview
Blue Yonder, a leading supply chain software company, is seeking a Product Director to join our Product Management team. This is a highly visible and impactful role responsible for leading the development and execution of our product strategy. The Product Director will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, sales, and marketing, to bring new products to market that meet the needs of our customers.
Acts as PMG Representative to key customers by providing thought leadership on solutions to business problems. Cares for and develops key customer and industry relationships by conducting customer and prospect needs research and maintaining key industry contacts. Collaborates with product teams to translate strategic direction into clear product objectives and roadmaps. Communicates product strategies and direction in a compelling manner. If manager, evaluates and determines optimal resource assignments for PMG associates. Ensures team roles, responsibilities and structure are effective. Evaluates client suitability for beta and client-funded partnerships. Manages and improves key customer and industry interaction. Manages and improves PMG processes by championing process improvement initiatives within or across applicable business units and within Product Management. Provides a clear vision and compelling leadership to all product stakeholders on product strategies and solutions to business problems. Provides strategic product/solution leadership by collaborating with Industry team to set product strategic direction and communicating this direction to all stakeholders. Researches, evaluates and recommends product packaging/bundling/pricing alternatives and third-party partnerships to Executive team.
What you’ll do* Lead the development and execution of the product strategy for Blue Yonder’ s Retail supply chain software products.
* Conduct market research and stay current with industry trends and competitor activities.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that products are delivered on time and meet customer needs.
* Define and prioritize product roadmap, gather customer requirements, and make data-driven recommendations for product enhancements.
* Measure and analyze the success of product launches and make recommendations for future improvements.
* Communicate product vision and strategy to stakeholders, both internally and externally.
* Gain an understanding of the Blue Yonder Stake holders and engage collaboratively with cross-functional teams


What we are looking for* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Business, or related field.
* Minimum of 10+ years of experience in product management, with a focus on supply chain software in Retail vertical specifically to Grocery chains.
* Experience in Grocery Retail as a practitioner a must, with broader Retail across all verticals experience an advantage.
* Proven track record of bringing software products to market successfully.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Experience working in Agile development methodologies.
* Knowledge of the supply chain software industry and the competitive landscape.

title_x: Product Manager, Product Hardware, Vehicle Accessories
description:
**Job Category** Operations & Business Support  

**Location** Hawthorne, California  

**Req. ID** 228194  

**Job Type** Full-time  




Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
Tesla is seeking a Hardware Product Manager focused on Vehicle Accessories to join our Global Vehicle Accessories and Merchandise team. This team is responsible for the overall Tesla Shop business with the Product Managers focused on the development, improvement and launch of aftermarket vehicle accessories for current and future vehicle programs. As a member of the Vehicle Accessories team, you will wear many hats and work in a fast-paced environment. This is a multi-faceted role where broad knowledge of product engineering, product development, supply chain, e-commerce management and material planning/distribution is critical. Successful candidates will demonstrate a strong ability to collaborate with a large number of internal stakeholders globally, ensuring best-in-class products are developed and launched according to our global product roadmap. You can see the types of accessories & merchandise you'll support on the Tesla Shop site.


What You’ll Do* Own and maintain a product roadmap for multiple hardware products across multiple vehicle models
* Lead market research, customer feedback and competitive diligence and analysis to build market and product requirements, documentation and inform engineering efforts
* Collaborate with Engineering teams to define, implement and track product development activities such as prototyping, design release, validation, tooling kickoff and production ramp
* Work with teams including Design, Engineering, Digital, Legal, Finance, Supply Chain, Service and Operations to deliver a seamless product experience
* Collaborate with Supply Chain teams to prospect, select and configure product and sub-product manufacturers which meet product intent, capacity, quality and compliance requirements
* Execute all release and administrative workstreams related to launching and maintaining engineered products on the Tesla Shop
* Define a set of metrics to measure customer satisfaction and product performance, and use these to analyze and make future decisions around the lifecycle of product portfolio
* Create and drive continuous architectural improvements on the business' platforms, workstreams and processes to maintain operational excellence

What You’ll Bring* Degree in Engineering or equivalent product-related/business degree or equivalent experience
* 2+ years of experience in product management, product development and shipping quality products with evidence of customer impact and exceptional ability
* Demonstrated ability to execute many projects and tasks in parallel, across teams, in a short timeframe with the ability to pivot rapidly
* Passionate about working with other businesses and partners to solve their specific challenges while putting customer trust and experience first
* Proven history of converting learnings from customer insights into tangible product features that customers love
* Entrepreneurial instincts with clear bias for informed action and track record of leading new initiatives with limited resources and support
* Strong analytical and quantitative skills with ability to use data and metrics for making assumptions and decisions
* Excellent written and verbal communications across technical and non-technical stakeholders

Compensation and Benefits
Benefits  

Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:
* Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
* Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
* Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution
* Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA
* Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* LGBTQ+ care concierge services
* 401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
* Company paid Basic Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
* Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
* Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
* Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs
* Tesla Babies program
* Commuter benefits
* Employee discounts and perks program
  
  

Expected Compensation  

$87,400 - $188,100/annual salary + cash and stock awards + benefits  

  

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.  

Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
Tesla is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

title_x: Product Marketing Manager - Virtual, United States
description:
**About Us**



WorkForce Software is the first global provider of workforce management solutions with integrated employee experience capabilities. The company’s WorkForce Suite adapts to each organization’s needs—no matter how unique their pay rules, labor regulations, and schedules—while delivering a breakthrough employee experience at the time and place work happens. Enterprise-grade and future-ready, WorkForce Software is helping some of the world’s most innovative organizations optimize their workforce, protect against compliance risks, and increase employee engagement to unlock new potential for resiliency and performance. Whether your employees are deskless or office workers, unionized, full-time, part-time, or seasonal, WorkForce Software makes managing your global workforce easy, less costly, and more rewarding for everyone.

  

Over one thousand organizations with more than 4 million users in over 100 countries rely on WorkForce Software solutions to streamline compliance, reduce labor costs, provide more intuitive tools to their employees, and achieve strategic HR on a global basis.

 **Your Opportunity to Make a Difference**



As a Product Marketing Manager at WorkForce Software, you will play a pivotal role in driving the success of our industry leading workforce management platform. This position requires a dynamic individual who excels in cross-functional and cross-regional collaboration, building strong internal and external relationships, and taking initiative to adapt and pivot in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.

  

You will lead the development and execution of comprehensive go-to-market plans, including product positioning, launch strategies, and sales enablement materials.

  

You will partner with creative teams to create compelling messaging and content that effectively communicates the value of our solutions to various audiences including customers, partners, analysts, and more.

  

You will partner with Sales leadership to effectively differentiate our solutions against the competition, reach target buyers and enable or sales organization to be successful in a global, fast-moving market.

  

In addition, selecting an enterprise workforce management solution is just the start of our typical customer’s journey. Large complex organizations are increasingly leveraging our expanding range of vendor services post selection to ensure they receive the maximum ROI from our solutions. As we continue to expand our portfolio of products many customers are expanding their technology footprint to access new elements of the WorkForce Suite, improving outcomes for the business and their employees.

  

In this role you will not only support market capture for new business but also help ensure our customers are successful throughout their implementation and grow the value they receive from WorkForce over time.

 **Responsibilities**

  


Most importantly the product marketing manager must use data to help inform the GTM decision making and marketing strategy for the products, services and customer segments you own, ensuring we reach our yearly booking and customer retention goals. Additionally, the product marketing manager must:

  

* Understand product offerings, our competitive differentiation and translate features / functionality into business value
* Use data to help inform the GTM decision making and marketing strategy for the products, services and customer segments you own, ensuring we reach our yearly booking and customer retention goals.
* Act as a market SME helping to maintain a thought leadership position for the products, services and customer segments you own in the key industries in which we operate
* Inform the strategy for reaching potential buyers by defining the most effective marketing tactics including events, media outlets, and influencers
* Ensure consistent messaging and branding across all WorkForce resources
* Identify opportunities to develop new resources, refine messaging and launch new campaigns that drive business growth
* Support vertical go-to-market initiatives with industry-specific resources and messaging
* Understand the competitive landscape and maintain competitive battlecards with up-to-date competitive differentiation and industry news
* Represent the voice of the customer and provide customer and market insights to the sales, customer success, product management, and marketing teams through our Customer Advisory Board and Regional User Groups
* Develop compelling and easy to understand resources for sales and presales including sales training on products, positioning, competitive analyses, FAQs, and cheat sheets
* Develop compelling external product content including data sheets and customer case studies, website content, blogs, eBooks, webinars, solution guides, product launches, etc.

  


**Requirements**


* 5+ years of experience in B2B product or content marketing for SaaS software
* Experience of the WFM, HCM or Payroll B2B SaaS software market is desirable
* Extensive experience in the development of creative content, product positioning, sales tools, customer case studies and competitive insights
* Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills
* Deep understanding of the enterprise software buyers' journey
* Track record of success measuring, testing, and improving the effectiveness of product messaging and sales tools at each level of the funnel
* Strong leadership qualities with the ability to coach, develop and motivate

  


**Travel**


* Up to 5%

  


**Education**


* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent.

  


**Why You Should Join the WorkForce Team?**


* Unlimited PTO
* Flexible Hours / Work from Home Policy
* 401k with Company Match
* Performance Bonus
* Career Development and Training – Be the CEO of your career!
        + Company paid LinkedIn Learning subscription.
* Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Initiatives including committees such as:
        + Women for Inclusion
        + Age: Unity Beyond Years
        + Racial Equality/Discrimination
        + Mental and Physical Ability
        + WorkForce Pride Network
        + Global Perspectives
        + Band of Veterans
* Health and Wellness / Gym Reimbursement
* Full Comprehensive Health Benefit Package
* Parental Leave
* Community Outreach Programs and Charitable Support

  



This job description is not intended to be all inclusive, and employee will perform other reasonably related business duties as assigned by the immediate supervisor and other management as required.

  


*To maintain our goal of remaining a diverse and inclusive company, WorkForce Software advocates for and promotes a diverse, equitable, safe, and professional workplace where all people feel welcomed and empowered. We are committed to creating an environment that supports and celebrates the full range of our individual and collective differences, so that everyone can do their best and most innovative work, on the job and in our communities.*

 *WorkForce Software is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, WorkForce Software will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at* *careers@workforcesoftware.com**, 1-833-987-3831.*

  




*WorkForce Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*
